person:biography.personal-details:content: Pieter Gillaerts is a PhD student at the Institute for civil procedure of the University of Leuven. His research focusses on the enforcement of non-compensatory goals of tort law through civil procedural instruments and is situated somewhere on the borderline between civil procedure and liability law. Before entering the PhD program he obtained a Bachelor’s degree in Law at the KU Leuven in cooperation with the HUB in Brussels (now called KU Leuven, Brussels campus) (2014, magna cum laude) and completed the Research Master in Law at the University of Leuven and the University of Tilburg (2016, magna cum laude). His Master’s degree dissertation discussed the compartmentalization and the principle of full compensation in Belgian non-contractual liability law.
